newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam Jan-Oct 15 trade gap narrows to $3.35 bln.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam Jan-Oct 15 trade gap narrows to $3.35 bln.

text.p: Vietnam posted a trade deficit of $3.35 billion in the period from January 1 to October 15, the Government Statistics Office said on Tuesday.
The latest figures showed the cumulative deficit narrowing from a record $3.54 billion between January 1 and September 10.
The statistics office, which does not report trade data on a regular basis, gave no comparative figures for corresponding periods in 1995. The trade gap for the whole of 1995 was $2.3 billion.
Exports from the beginning of the year until mid-October were $5.53 billion and imports were $8.88 billion.
